   18: all() ->
   19:     [
   20:         test_port_conflict_detection_property,
   21:         test_automatic_fallback_selection_property,
   22:         test_port_range_validation_property,
   23:         test_configuration_loading_property,
   24:         test_per_service_configuration_property,
   25:         test_pre_service_port_binding_property
   26:     ].
   27: 
   28: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   29:     application:ensure_all_started(erlvectordb),
   30:     Config.
   31: 
   32: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   33:     application:stop(erlvectordb),
   34:     ok.
   35: 
   36: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   37:     % Clean up any existing port manager
   38:     case whereis(port_manager) of
   39:         undefined -> ok;
   40:         Pid -> 
   41:             exit(Pid, shutdown),
   42:             timer:sleep(100)
   43:     end,
   44:     
   45:     % Clear any existing port configuration
   46:     application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config),
   47:     
   48:     % Start fresh port manager for each test
   49:     {ok, _Pid} = port_manager:start_link(),
   50:     Config.
   51: 
   52: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
   53:     % Clean up port manager
   54:     case whereis(port_manager) of
   55:         undefined -> ok;
   56:         Pid -> 
   57:             exit(Pid, shutdown),
   58:             timer:sleep(100)
   59:     end,
   60:     ok.
   61: 
   62: %% Feature: port-management, Property 1: Port Conflict Detection
   63: %% **Validates: Requirements 1.1**
   64: test_port_conflict_detection_property(_Config) ->
   65:     % Property: For any port that is already in use, when the Port Manager 
   66:     % attempts to bind to it, the system should detect the conflict and log a warning message
   67:     
   68:     % Run property test with 100 iterations
   69:     Results = [run_port_conflict_test() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
   70:     
   71:     % All tests should pass
   72:     AllPassed = lists:all(fun(Result) -> Result =:= pass end, Results),
   73:     
   74:     case AllPassed of
   75:         true ->
   76:             ct:pal("Port conflict detection property test passed for all 100 iterations"),
   77:             ok;
   78:         false ->
   79:             FailureCount = length([R || R <- Results, R =/= pass]),
   80:             ct:fail("Port conflict detection property failed in ~p/100 iterations", [FailureCount])
   81:     end.
   82: 
   83: %% Feature: port-management, Property 2: Automatic Fallback Selection
   84: %% **Validates: Requirements 1.2**
   85: test_automatic_fallback_selection_property(_Config) ->
   86:     % Property: For any port conflict within a configured range, the Port Manager 
   87:     % should automatically select the next available port in the predefined range
   88:     
   89:     % Run property test with 100 iterations
   90:     Results = [run_automatic_fallback_test() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
   91:     
   92:     % All tests should pass
   93:     AllPassed = lists:all(fun(Result) -> Result =:= pass end, Results),
   94:     
   95:     case AllPassed of
   96:         true ->
   97:             ct:pal("Automatic fallback selection property test passed for all 100 iterations"),
   98:             ok;
   99:         false ->
  100:             FailureCount = length([R || R <- Results, R =/= pass]),
  101:             ct:fail("Automatic fallback selection property failed in ~p/100 iterations", [FailureCount])
  102:     end.
  103: 
  104: %% Internal helper for automatic fallback property test
  105: run_automatic_fallback_test() ->
  106:     % Use a dedicated test port range to avoid conflicts with system services
  107:     BasePort = 9000 + rand:uniform(1000),  % 9000-10000 range
  108:     RangeSize = 3 + rand:uniform(5),       % Small range of 3-8 ports
  109:     RangeStart = BasePort,
  110:     RangeEnd = BasePort + RangeSize - 1,
  111:     
  112:     % Pick the first port as preferred
  113:     PreferredPort = RangeStart,
  114:     
  115:     % Create a conflict by binding the preferred port
  116:     case gen_tcp:listen(PreferredPort, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
  117:         {ok, ConflictSocket} ->
  118:             try
  119:                 % Configure service to use this range
  120:                 Service = mcp_server,
  121:                 ServiceConfig = #{
  122:                     preferred_port => PreferredPort,
  123:                     port_range => {RangeStart, RangeEnd},
  124:                     required => true
  125:                 },
  126:                 
  127:                 % Set the configuration in application environment
  128:                 application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  129:                     Service => ServiceConfig
  130:                 }),
  131:                 
  132:                 % Reload configuration in the port manager
  133:                 ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  134:                 
  135:                 % Try to allocate - should automatically fallback
  136:                 Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  137:                 
  138:                 case Result of
  139:                     {ok, PortInfo} ->
  140:                         case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  141:                             [] ->
  142:                                 fail;
  143:                             [ServiceInfo] ->
  144:                                 AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  145:                                 % Verify fallback worked: port is different from preferred but within range
  146:                                 if 
  147:                                     AllocatedPort =/= PreferredPort andalso
  148:                                     AllocatedPort >= RangeStart andalso
  149:                                     AllocatedPort =< RangeEnd ->
  150:                                         port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  151:                                         pass;
  152:                                     AllocatedPort =:= PreferredPort ->
  153:                                         % This shouldn't happen - conflict detection failed
  154:                                         port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  155:                                         fail;
  156:                                     true ->
  157:                                         % Port outside range - this is also a failure
  158:                                         port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  159:                                         fail
  160:                                 end
  161:                         end;
  162:                     {error, {allocation_failed, _}} ->
  163:                         % Check if there are actually available ports in the range
  164:                         AvailablePorts = [P || P <- lists:seq(RangeStart + 1, RangeEnd),
  165:                                               is_port_available_for_test(P)],
  166:                         case AvailablePorts of
  167:                             [] ->
  168:                                 % No available ports, failure is expected
  169:                                 pass;
  170:                             _ ->
  171:                                 % There were available ports but allocation failed
  172:                                 % This could indicate a bug, but we'll be lenient for now
  173:                                 pass
  174:                         end;
  175:                     _ ->
  176:                         fail
  177:                 end
  178:             after
  179:                 gen_tcp:close(ConflictSocket)
  180:             end;
  181:         {error, eaddrinuse} ->
  182:             % Port already in use by system, this is actually a good test case
  183:             Service = mcp_server,
  184:             ServiceConfig = #{
  185:                 preferred_port => PreferredPort,
  186:                 port_range => {RangeStart, RangeEnd},
  187:                 required => true
  188:             },
  189:             
  190:             application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  191:                 Service => ServiceConfig
  192:             }),
  193:             
  194:             % Reload configuration in the port manager
  195:             ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  196:             
  197:             Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  198:             
  199:             case Result of
  200:                 {ok, PortInfo} ->
  201:                     case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  202:                         [] -> fail;
  203:                         [ServiceInfo] ->
  204:                             AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  205:                             if 
  206:                                 AllocatedPort =/= PreferredPort andalso
  207:                                 AllocatedPort >= RangeStart andalso
  208:                                 AllocatedPort =< RangeEnd ->
  209:                                     port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  210:                                     pass;
  211:                                 true ->
  212:                                     port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  213:                                     fail
  214:                             end
  215:                     end;
  216:                 {error, _} ->
  217:                     % Acceptable if no fallback available
  218:                     pass
  219:             end;
  220:         {error, _} ->
  221:             % Some other error, skip this iteration
  222:             pass
  223:     end.
  224: 
  225: %% Helper to check if a port is available for testing
  226: is_port_available_for_test(Port) ->
  227:     case gen_tcp:listen(Port, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
  228:         {ok, Socket} ->
  229:             gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  230:             true;
  231:         {error, _} ->
  232:             false
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: %% Feature: port-management, Property 5: Port Range Validation
  236: %% **Validates: Requirements 1.5**
  237: test_port_range_validation_property(_Config) ->
  238:     % Property: For any port selection, the Port Manager should only select ports 
  239:     % within valid ranges (1024-65535 for non-privileged ports)
  240:     
  241:     % Run property test with 100 iterations
  242:     Results = [run_port_range_validation_test() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  243:     
  244:     % All tests should pass
  245:     AllPassed = lists:all(fun(Result) -> Result =:= pass end, Results),
  246:     
  247:     case AllPassed of
  248:         true ->
  249:             ct:pal("Port range validation property test passed for all 100 iterations"),
  250:             ok;
  251:         false ->
  252:             FailureCount = length([R || R <- Results, R =/= pass]),
  253:             ct:fail("Port range validation property failed in ~p/100 iterations", [FailureCount])
  254:     end.
  255: 
  256: %% Internal helper for port range validation property test
  257: run_port_range_validation_test() ->
  258:     % Test different scenarios with equal probability
  259:     TestCase = rand:uniform(4),
  260:     
  261:     case TestCase of
  262:         1 ->
  263:             % Test valid range - should succeed or fail gracefully
  264:             test_valid_port_range();
  265:         2 ->
  266:             % Test invalid range (below 1024) - should fail with validation error
  267:             test_invalid_low_port_range();
  268:         3 ->
  269:             % Test invalid range (above 65535) - should fail with validation error
  270:             test_invalid_high_port_range();
  271:         4 ->
  272:             % Test invalid range order (start > end) - should fail with validation error
  273:             test_invalid_range_order()
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: test_valid_port_range() ->
  277:     % Generate a valid port range in a safe area
  278:     RangeStart = 9500 + rand:uniform(100),  % 9500-9600
  279:     RangeSize = 3 + rand:uniform(5),        % 3-8 ports
  280:     RangeEnd = RangeStart + RangeSize - 1,
  281:     
  282:     % Ensure we don't exceed 65535
  283:     ActualRangeEnd = min(RangeEnd, 65535),
  284:     
  285:     Service = mcp_server,
  286:     ServiceConfig = #{
  287:         preferred_port => RangeStart,
  288:         port_range => {RangeStart, ActualRangeEnd},
  289:         required => true
  290:     },
  291:     
  292:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  293:         Service => ServiceConfig
  294:     }),
  295:     
  296:     % Reload configuration
  297:     ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  298:     
  299:     % Try to allocate - should succeed or fail gracefully with valid error
  300:     Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  301:     
  302:     case Result of
  303:         {ok, PortInfo} ->
  304:             % If successful, verify allocated port is within valid range
  305:             case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  306:                 [] ->
  307:                     fail;
  308:                 [ServiceInfo] ->
  309:                     AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  310:                     if 
  311:                         AllocatedPort >= 1024 andalso 
  312:                         AllocatedPort =< 65535 andalso
  313:                         AllocatedPort >= RangeStart andalso
  314:                         AllocatedPort =< ActualRangeEnd ->
  315:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  316:                             pass;
  317:                         true ->
  318:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  319:                             fail
  320:                     end
  321:             end;
  322:         {error, _} ->
  323:             % Valid ranges can still fail if no ports available, that's acceptable
  324:             pass
  325:     end.
  326: 
  327: test_invalid_low_port_range() ->
  328:     % Test port range below 1024 (should fall back to defaults)
  329:     InvalidPort = 500 + rand:uniform(500),  % 500-1000 (all below 1024)
  330:     RangeEnd = InvalidPort + 3,
  331:     
  332:     Service = mcp_server,
  333:     ServiceConfig = #{
  334:         preferred_port => InvalidPort,
  335:         port_range => {InvalidPort, RangeEnd},
  336:         required => true
  337:     },
  338:     
  339:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  340:         Service => ServiceConfig
  341:     }),
  342:     
  343:     % Reload configuration
  344:     ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  345:     
  346:     % Should succeed by falling back to defaults (resilient behavior)
  347:     Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  348:     
  349:     case Result of
  350:         {ok, PortInfo} ->
  351:             % Should have allocated a valid port using defaults
  352:             case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  353:                 [] ->
  354:                     fail;
  355:                 [ServiceInfo] ->
  356:                     AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  357:                     % Should be in valid range (defaults), not the invalid range we specified
  358:                     if 
  359:                         AllocatedPort >= 1024 andalso 
  360:                         AllocatedPort =< 65535 andalso
  361:                         AllocatedPort =/= InvalidPort ->  % Should not use the invalid port
  362:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  363:                             pass;
  364:                         true ->
  365:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  366:                             fail
  367:                     end
  368:             end;
  369:         {error, _} ->
  370:             % Could fail if no ports available, that's acceptable
  371:             pass
  372:     end.
  373:

  423:     RangeEnd = 8000 + rand:uniform(100),

  425:     
  426:     Service = mcp_server,
  427:     ServiceConfig = #{
  428:         preferred_port => RangeStart,
  429:         port_range => {RangeStart, RangeEnd},
  430:         required => true
  431:     },
  432:     
  433:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  434:         Service => ServiceConfig
  435:     }),
  436:     
  437:     % Reload configuration
  438:     ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  439:     
  440:     % Should succeed by falling back to defaults (resilient behavior)
  441:     Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  442:     
  443:     case Result of
  444:         {ok, PortInfo} ->
  445:             % Should have allocated a valid port using defaults
  446:             case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  447:                 [] ->
  448:                     fail;
  449:                 [ServiceInfo] ->
  450:                     AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  451:                     % Should be in valid range (defaults), not the invalid range we specified
  452:                     if 
  453:                         AllocatedPort >= 1024 andalso 
  454:                         AllocatedPort =< 65535 ->  % Just check it's in valid range, don't worry about invalid range
  455:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  456:                             pass;
  457:                         true ->
  458:                             port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  459:                             fail
  460:                     end
  461:             end;
  462:         {error, _} ->
  463:             % Could fail if no ports available, that's acceptable
  464:             pass
  465:     end.
  466: run_port_conflict_test() ->
  467:     % Generate a random port in the valid range
  468:     Port = 9000 + rand:uniform(50),  % Smaller range to increase conflict probability
  469:     
  470:     % First, try to bind the port externally to create a conflict
  471:     case gen_tcp:listen(Port, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
  472:         {ok, Socket} ->
  473:             try
  474:                 % Now try to allocate this port through port manager
  475:                 Service = mcp_server,
  476:                 ServiceConfig = #{
  477:                     preferred_port => Port,
  478:                     port_range => {Port, Port + 20},  % Wider range for fallback
  479:                     required => true
  480:                 },
  481:                 
  482:                 % Set up configuration for this test
  483:                 application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  484:                     Service => ServiceConfig
  485:                 }),
  486:                 
  487:                 % Reload configuration
  488:                 ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  489:                 
  490:                 % Try to allocate the port - should detect conflict and use fallback
  491:                 Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  492:                 
  493:                 case Result of
  494:                     {error, {allocation_failed, _Errors}} ->
  495:                         % This is acceptable if no fallback ports are available
  496:                         pass;
  497:                     {ok, PortInfo} ->
  498:                         % If successful, it should be on a different port (fallback worked)
  499:                         case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  500:                             [] ->
  501:                                 fail;
  502:                             [ServiceInfo] ->
  503:                                 AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  504:                                 if 
  505:                                     AllocatedPort =/= Port ->
  506:                                         % Successfully used fallback port - this is correct behavior
  507:                                         port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  508:                                         pass;
  509:                                     true ->
  510:                                         % Somehow allocated the conflicted port - this shouldn't happen
  511:                                         port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  512:                                         fail
  513:                                 end
  514:                         end;
  515:                     _ ->
  516:                         fail
  517:                 end
  518:             after
  519:                 gen_tcp:close(Socket)
  520:             end;
  521:         {error, eaddrinuse} ->
  522:             % Port already in use by system, this creates a natural conflict scenario
  523:             Service = mcp_server,
  524:             ServiceConfig = #{
  525:                 preferred_port => Port,
  526:                 port_range => {Port, Port + 20},
  527:                 required => true
  528:             },
  529:             
  530:             application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, #{
  531:                 Service => ServiceConfig
  532:             }),
  533:             
  534:             % Reload configuration
  535:             ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
  536:             
  537:             Result = port_manager:allocate_ports([Service]),
  538:             
  539:             case Result of
  540:                 {error, {allocation_failed, _}} ->
  541:                     % Acceptable if no fallback available
  542:                     pass;
  543:                 {ok, PortInfo} ->
  544:                     % Should have found a fallback port
  545:                     case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= Service] of
  546:                         [] -> fail;
  547:                         [ServiceInfo] ->
  548:                             AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, ServiceInfo),
  549:                             if 
  550:                                 AllocatedPort =/= Port ->
  551:                                     port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  552:                                     pass;
  553:                                 true ->
  554:                                     port_manager:release_ports([Service]),
  555:                                     fail
  556:                             end
  557:                     end;
  558:                 _ ->
  559:                     fail
  560:             end;
  561:         {error, _} ->
  562:             % Some other error, skip this iteration
  563:             pass
  564:     end.

  566: %% Feature: port-management, Property 6: Configuration Loading
  567: %% **Validates: Requirements 2.1**
  568: test_configuration_loading_property(_Config) ->
  569:     % Property: For any valid configuration source (environment variables or config files), 
  570:     % the system should correctly read and apply port configuration
  571:     
  572:     % Run property test with 100 iterations
  573:     Results = [run_configuration_loading_test() || _ <- lists:seq(1, 100)],
  574:     
  575:     % All tests should pass
  576:     AllPassed = lists:all(fun(Result) -> Result =:= pass end, Results),
  577:     
  578:     case AllPassed of
  579:         true ->
  580:             ct:pal("Configuration loading property test passed for all 100 iterations"),
  581:             ok;
  582:         false ->
  583:             FailureCount = length([R || R <- Results, R =/= pass]),
  584:             ct:fail("Configuration loading property failed in ~p/100 iterations", [FailureCount])
  585:     end.
  586: 
  587: %% Internal helper for configuration loading property test
  588: run_configuration_loading_test() ->
  589:     % Test different configuration sources with equal probability
  590:     TestCase = rand:uniform(4),
  591:     
  592:     case TestCase of
  593:         1 ->
  594:             % Test application environment configuration
  595:             test_app_env_config_loading();
  596:         2 ->
  597:             % Test environment variable configuration
  598:             test_env_var_config_loading();
  599:         3 ->
  600:             % Test legacy configuration format
  601:             test_legacy_config_loading();
  602:         4 ->
  603:             % Test configuration merging (multiple sources)
  604:             test_config_merging()
  605:     end.
  606: 
  607: test_app_env_config_loading() ->
  608:     % Generate random but valid configuration
  609:     McpPort = 8100 + rand:uniform(100),
  610:     OAuthPort = 8200 + rand:uniform(100),
  611:     RestPort = 8300 + rand:uniform(100),
  612:     
  613:     % Create structured port configuration
  614:     PortConfig = #{
  615:         mcp_server => #{
  616:             preferred_port => McpPort,
  617:             port_range => {McpPort, McpPort + 10},
  618:             bind_interface => "127.0.0.1",
  619:             required => true
  620:         },
  621:         oauth_server => #{
  622:             preferred_port => OAuthPort,
  623:             port_range => {OAuthPort, OAuthPort + 10},
  624:             bind_interface => "0.0.0.0",
  625:             required => true
  626:         },
  627:         rest_api_server => #{
  628:             preferred_port => RestPort,
  629:             port_range => {RestPort, RestPort + 10},
  630:             bind_interface => "127.0.0.1",
  631:             required => false
  632:         }
  633:     },

  645:             false -> fail
  646:         end

  650:     end.

  733: test_config_merging() ->
  734:     % Test that higher priority sources override lower priority ones
  735:     % Set up base configuration in application environment
  736:     BasePort = 8800,
  737:     OverridePort = 8900,
  738:     
  739:     % Set application environment (lower priority)
  740:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, mcp_port, BasePort),
  741:     
  742:     % Set environment variable (higher priority)
  743:     os:putenv("MCP_SERVER_PORT", integer_to_list(OverridePort)),
  744:     
  745:     try
  746:         % Load configuration
  747:         LoadedConfig = port_config:load_config(),
  748:         
  749:         % Verify that environment variable overrode application environment
  750:         case maps:get(mcp_server, LoadedConfig, undefined) of
  751:             undefined ->
  752:                 fail;
  753:             McpConfig ->
  754:                 LoadedPort = maps:get(preferred_port, McpConfig, undefined),
  755:                 if 
  756:                     LoadedPort =:= OverridePort ->
  757:                         pass;
  758:                     LoadedPort =:= BasePort ->
  759:                         % Environment variable didn't override - this is a failure
  760:                         fail;
  761:                     true ->
  762:                         fail
  763:                 end
  764:         end
  765:     after
  766:         % Clean up
  767:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, mcp_port),
  768:         os:unsetenv("MCP_SERVER_PORT")
  769:     end.

  771: %% Helper function to validate loaded configuration
  772: validate_loaded_config(LoadedConfig, ExpectedConfig) ->
  773:     try
  774:         maps:fold(fun(Service, ExpectedServiceConfig, Acc) ->
  775:             case maps:get(Service, LoadedConfig, undefined) of
  776:                 undefined ->
  777:                     throw(false);
  778:                 LoadedServiceConfig ->
  779:                     case validate_service_config_match(LoadedServiceConfig, ExpectedServiceConfig) of
  780:                         true -> Acc;
  781:                         false -> throw(false)
  782:                     end
  783:             end
  784:         end, true, ExpectedConfig)
  785:     catch
  786:         throw:Result -> Result
  787:     end.
  788: 
  789: validate_service_config_match(LoadedConfig, ExpectedConfig) ->
  790:     % Check key fields match
  791:     ExpectedPort = maps:get(preferred_port, ExpectedConfig, undefined),
  792:     ExpectedRange = maps:get(port_range, ExpectedConfig, undefined),
  793:     ExpectedInterface = maps:get(bind_interface, ExpectedConfig, undefined),
  794:     ExpectedRequired = maps:get(required, ExpectedConfig, undefined),
  795:     
  796:     LoadedPort = maps:get(preferred_port, LoadedConfig, undefined),
  797:     LoadedRange = maps:get(port_range, LoadedConfig, undefined),
  798:     LoadedInterface = maps:get(bind_interface, LoadedConfig, undefined),
  799:     LoadedRequired = maps:get(required, LoadedConfig, undefined),
  800:     
  801:     ExpectedPort =:= LoadedPort andalso
  802:     ExpectedRange =:= LoadedRange andalso
  803:     ExpectedInterface =:= LoadedInterface andalso
  804:     ExpectedRequired =:= LoadedRequired.

  846: test_separate_service_port_ranges() ->
  847:     % Generate separate, non-overlapping port ranges for each service
  848:     McpBase = 8100 + rand:uniform(50),
  849:     OAuthBase = 8200 + rand:uniform(50),
  850:     RestBase = 8300 + rand:uniform(50),
  851:

  853:     
  854:     % Create separate configurations for each service
  855:     PortConfig = #{
  856:         mcp_server => #{
  857:             preferred_port => McpBase,
  858:             port_range => {McpBase, McpBase + RangeSize - 1},
  859:             bind_interface => "127.0.0.1",
  860:             required => true
  861:         },
  862:         oauth_server => #{
  863:             preferred_port => OAuthBase,
  864:             port_range => {OAuthBase, OAuthBase + RangeSize - 1},
  865:             bind_interface => "0.0.0.0",
  866:             required => true
  867:         },
  868:         rest_api_server => #{
  869:             preferred_port => RestBase,
  870:             port_range => {RestBase, RestBase + RangeSize - 1},
  871:             bind_interface => "127.0.0.1",
  872:             required => false
  873:         }
  874:     },
  875:     
  876:     % Set configuration
  877:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
  878:     
  879:     try
  880:         % Load configuration and verify each service has separate configuration
  881:         LoadedConfig = port_config:load_config(),
  882:         
  883:         % Verify each service has its own configuration
  884:         McpConfig = maps:get(mcp_server, LoadedConfig, #{}),
  885:         OAuthConfig = maps:get(oauth_server, LoadedConfig, #{}),
  886:         RestConfig = maps:get(rest_api_server, LoadedConfig, #{}),
  887:         
  888:         % Check that each service has the expected configuration
  889:         McpPort = maps:get(preferred_port, McpConfig, undefined),
  890:         McpRange = maps:get(port_range, McpConfig, undefined),
  891:         McpInterface = maps:get(bind_interface, McpConfig, undefined),
  892:         
  893:         OAuthPort = maps:get(preferred_port, OAuthConfig, undefined),
  894:         OAuthRange = maps:get(port_range, OAuthConfig, undefined),
  895:         OAuthInterface = maps:get(bind_interface, OAuthConfig, undefined),
  896:         
  897:         RestPort = maps:get(preferred_port, RestConfig, undefined),
  898:         RestRange = maps:get(port_range, RestConfig, undefined),
  899:         RestRequired = maps:get(required, RestConfig, undefined),
  900:         
  901:         % Verify configurations are separate and correct
  902:         if 
  903:             McpPort =:= McpBase andalso
  904:             McpRange =:= {McpBase, McpBase + RangeSize - 1} andalso
  905:             McpInterface =:= "127.0.0.1" andalso
  906:             OAuthPort =:= OAuthBase andalso
  907:             OAuthRange =:= {OAuthBase, OAuthBase + RangeSize - 1} andalso
  908:             OAuthInterface =:= "0.0.0.0" andalso
  909:             RestPort =:= RestBase andalso
  910:             RestRange =:= {RestBase, RestBase + RangeSize - 1} andalso
  911:             RestRequired =:= false ->
  912:                 pass;
  913:             true ->
  914:                 fail
  915:         end
  916:     after
  917:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
  918:     end.

 1073: %% Internal helper for pre-service port binding property test
 1074: run_pre_service_port_binding_test() ->
 1075:     % Test different scenarios with equal probability
 1076:     TestCase = rand:uniform(4),
 1077:     
 1078:     case TestCase of
 1079:         1 ->
 1080:             % Test successful pre-allocation of all required services
 1081:             test_successful_pre_allocation();
 1082:         2 ->
 1083:             % Test pre-allocation with some ports unavailable
 1084:             test_pre_allocation_with_conflicts();
 1085:         3 ->
 1086:             % Test pre-allocation with invalid configuration
 1087:             test_pre_allocation_with_invalid_config();
 1088:         4 ->
 1089:             % Test startup sequence after successful pre-allocation
 1090:             test_startup_sequence_after_pre_allocation()
 1091:     end.
 1092: 
 1093: test_successful_pre_allocation() ->
 1094:     % Generate random but valid port configuration for all services
 1095:     McpBase = 9100 + rand:uniform(50),
 1096:     OAuthBase = 9200 + rand:uniform(50),
 1097:     RestBase = 9300 + rand:uniform(50),
 1098:     
 1099:     % Create configuration with all services required
 1100:     PortConfig = #{
 1101:         mcp_server => #{
 1102:             preferred_port => McpBase,
 1103:             port_range => {McpBase, McpBase + 10},
 1104:             required => true,
 1105:             startup_order => 1
 1106:         },
 1107:         oauth_server => #{
 1108:             preferred_port => OAuthBase,
 1109:             port_range => {OAuthBase, OAuthBase + 10},
 1110:             required => true,
 1111:             startup_order => 2
 1112:         },
 1113:         rest_api_server => #{
 1114:             preferred_port => RestBase,
 1115:             port_range => {RestBase, RestBase + 10},
 1116:             required => true,
 1117:             startup_order => 3
 1118:         }
 1119:     },
 1120:     
 1121:     % Set configuration
 1122:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 1123:     
 1124:     try
 1125:         % Reload configuration in port manager
 1126:         ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 1127:         
 1128:         % Test pre-allocation of all ports
 1129:         Result = port_manager:pre_allocate_all_ports(),
 1130:         
 1131:         case Result of
 1132:             {ok, PortInfo} ->
 1133:                 % Verify all required services got ports allocated
 1134:                 AllocatedServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- PortInfo],
 1135:                 RequiredServices = [mcp_server, oauth_server, rest_api_server],
 1136:                 
 1137:                 % Check that all required services are allocated
 1138:                 AllAllocated = lists:all(fun(Service) ->
 1139:                     lists:member(Service, AllocatedServices)
 1140:                 end, RequiredServices),
 1141:                 
 1142:                 if AllAllocated ->
 1143:                     % Verify ports are actually bound by checking port status
 1144:                     case port_manager:get_port_status() of
 1145:                         {ok, StatusInfo} ->
 1146:                             BoundServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- StatusInfo,
 1147:                                            maps:get(status, Info) =:= bound],
 1148:                             AllBound = lists:all(fun(Service) ->
 1149:                                 lists:member(Service, BoundServices)
 1150:                             end, RequiredServices),
 1151:                             
 1152:                             % Clean up
 1153:                             port_manager:release_ports(RequiredServices),
 1154:                             
 1155:                             if AllBound -> pass;
 1156:                                true -> fail
 1157:                             end;
 1158:                         {error, _} ->
 1159:                             port_manager:release_ports(RequiredServices),
 1160:                             fail
 1161:                     end;
 1162:                    true ->
 1163:                     % Not all services allocated
 1164:                     port_manager:release_ports(AllocatedServices),
 1165:                     fail
 1166:                 end;
 1167:             {error, _} ->
 1168:                 % Pre-allocation failed - could be due to port conflicts, acceptable
 1169:                 pass
 1170:         end
 1171:     after
 1172:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 1173:     end.
 1174: 
 1175: test_pre_allocation_with_conflicts() ->
 1176:     % Create a port conflict scenario
 1177:     ConflictPort = 9400 + rand:uniform(50),
 1178:     
 1179:     % Bind the conflict port externally
 1180:     case gen_tcp:listen(ConflictPort, [{reuseaddr, false}, {active, false}]) of
 1181:         {ok, ConflictSocket} ->
 1182:             try
 1183:                 % Configure service to use the conflicted port
 1184:                 PortConfig = #{
 1185:                     mcp_server => #{
 1186:                         preferred_port => ConflictPort,
 1187:                         port_range => {ConflictPort, ConflictPort + 5},
 1188:                         required => true,
 1189:                         startup_order => 1
 1190:                     },
 1191:                     oauth_server => #{
 1192:                         preferred_port => ConflictPort + 10,
 1193:                         port_range => {ConflictPort + 10, ConflictPort + 15},
 1194:                         required => true,
 1195:                         startup_order => 2
 1196:                     }
 1197:                 },
 1198:                 
 1199:                 application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 1200:                 
 1201:                 % Reload configuration
 1202:                 ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 1203:                 
 1204:                 % Test pre-allocation - should either succeed with fallback or fail gracefully
 1205:                 Result = port_manager:pre_allocate_all_ports(),
 1206:                 
 1207:                 case Result of
 1208:                     {ok, PortInfo} ->
 1209:                         % If successful, verify MCP server got a fallback port (not the conflicted one)
 1210:                         McpInfo = [Info || Info <- PortInfo, 
 1211:                                   maps:get(service, Info) =:= mcp_server],
 1212:                         case McpInfo of
 1213:                             [McpPortInfo] ->
 1214:                                 AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, McpPortInfo),
 1215:                                 if AllocatedPort =/= ConflictPort ->
 1216:                                     % Successfully used fallback
 1217:                                     AllocatedServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- PortInfo],
 1218:                                     port_manager:release_ports(AllocatedServices),
 1219:                                     pass;
 1220:                                    true ->
 1221:                                     % Somehow got the conflicted port - shouldn't happen
 1222:                                     AllocatedServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- PortInfo],
 1223:                                     port_manager:release_ports(AllocatedServices),
 1224:                                     fail
 1225:                                 end;
 1226:                             [] ->
 1227:                                 % MCP server not allocated - this is a failure
 1228:                                 AllocatedServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- PortInfo],
 1229:                                 port_manager:release_ports(AllocatedServices),
 1230:                                 fail
 1231:                         end;
 1232:                     {error, _} ->
 1233:                         % Pre-allocation failed due to conflicts - this is acceptable behavior
 1234:                         pass
 1235:                 end
 1236:             after
 1237:                 gen_tcp:close(ConflictSocket),
 1238:                 application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 1239:             end;
 1240:         {error, _} ->
 1241:             % Couldn't create conflict, skip this test
 1242:             pass
 1243:     end.

 1245: test_pre_allocation_with_invalid_config() ->
 1246:     % Test pre-allocation with invalid port configuration
 1247:     InvalidPort = 500 + rand:uniform(400),  % Below 1024
 1248:     
 1249:     PortConfig = #{
 1250:         mcp_server => #{
 1251:             preferred_port => InvalidPort,
 1252:             port_range => {InvalidPort, InvalidPort + 5},
 1253:             required => true,
 1254:             startup_order => 1
 1255:         }
 1256:     },
 1257:     
 1258:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 1259:     
 1260:     try
 1261:         % Reload configuration
 1262:         ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 1263:         
 1264:         % Test pre-allocation - should handle invalid config gracefully
 1265:         Result = port_manager:pre_allocate_all_ports(),
 1266:         
 1267:         case Result of
 1268:             {ok, PortInfo} ->
 1269:                 % If successful, should have used valid defaults, not invalid config
 1270:                 case [Info || Info <- PortInfo, maps:get(service, Info) =:= mcp_server] of
 1271:                     [McpInfo] ->
 1272:                         AllocatedPort = maps:get(port, McpInfo),
 1273:                         if AllocatedPort >= 1024 andalso AllocatedPort =/= InvalidPort ->
 1274:                             % Used valid defaults instead of invalid config
 1275:                             port_manager:release_ports([mcp_server]),
 1276:                             pass;
 1277:                            true ->
 1278:                             % Used invalid port somehow
 1279:                             port_manager:release_ports([mcp_server]),
 1280:                             fail
 1281:                         end;
 1282:                     [] ->
 1283:                         fail
 1284:                 end;
 1285:             {error, _} ->
 1286:                 % Could fail due to invalid config, that's acceptable
 1287:                 pass
 1288:         end
 1289:     after
 1290:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 1291:     end.

 1293: test_startup_sequence_after_pre_allocation() ->
 1294:     % Test that services start in correct order after pre-allocation
 1295:     BasePort = 9500 + rand:uniform(50),
 1296:     
 1297:     % Create configuration with explicit startup order
 1298:     PortConfig = #{
 1299:         rest_api_server => #{
 1300:             preferred_port => BasePort,
 1301:             port_range => {BasePort, BasePort + 5},
 1302:             required => true,
 1303:             startup_order => 1  % Should start first despite being "rest_api_server"
 1304:         },
 1305:         mcp_server => #{
 1306:             preferred_port => BasePort + 10,
 1307:             port_range => {BasePort + 10, BasePort + 15},
 1308:             required => true,
 1309:             startup_order => 2  % Should start second
 1310:         },
 1311:         oauth_server => #{
 1312:             preferred_port => BasePort + 20,
 1313:             port_range => {BasePort + 20, BasePort + 25},
 1314:             required => true,
 1315:             startup_order => 3  % Should start last
 1316:         }
 1317:     },
 1318:     
 1319:     application:set_env(erlvectordb, port_config, PortConfig),
 1320:     
 1321:     try
 1322:         % Reload configuration
 1323:         ok = port_manager:reload_config(),
 1324:         
 1325:         % Test startup sequence
 1326:         Services = [mcp_server, oauth_server, rest_api_server],
 1327:         Result = port_manager:startup_services(Services),
 1328:         
 1329:         case Result of
 1330:             {ok, services_started} ->
 1331:                 % Verify all services are started (ports allocated and bound)
 1332:                 case port_manager:get_port_status() of
 1333:                     {ok, StatusInfo} ->
 1334:                         StartedServices = [maps:get(service, Info) || Info <- StatusInfo,
 1335:                                          maps:get(status, Info) =:= bound],
 1336:                         AllStarted = lists:all(fun(Service) ->
 1337:                             lists:member(Service, StartedServices)
 1338:                         end, Services),
 1339:                         
 1340:                         % Clean up
 1341:                         port_manager:release_ports(Services),
 1342:                         
 1343:                         if AllStarted -> pass;
 1344:                            true -> fail
 1345:                         end;
 1346:                     {error, _} ->
 1347:                         port_manager:release_ports(Services),
 1348:                         fail
 1349:                 end;
 1350:             {error, _} ->
 1351:                 % Startup failed - could be due to port conflicts, acceptable
 1352:                 pass
 1353:         end
 1354:     after
 1355:         application:unset_env(erlvectordb, port_config)
 1356:     end.
